pr_title: MAPREDUCE-7280. MiniMRYarnCluster has hard-coded timeout waiting to start history server, with no way to disable.

timeline.message: MAPREDUCE-7280. MiniMRYarnCluster has hard-coded timeout waiting to start history server, with no way to disable.

timeline.bodyText: Should this historyServer and thread only be initialized when the new configuration is enabled? Would be nice to avoid allocating the resources if we don't need them.
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: historyServer is not initialized if mapreduce.jobhistory.minicluster.enabled is set to false. I would like to keep the default value to be true to avoid breaking existing tests of hadoop and downstreams.
replies.author: iwasakims

replies.bodyText: Yes, preserving the default value makes sense. I'm just wondering if the resource allocation can be skipped entirely when the jhs is disabled.
replies.author: ndimiduk

timeline.bodyText: nit: this code would be simpler using a CountDownLatch.
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: I removed the jhsStarted var in a bit different way.
replies.author: iwasakims

timeline.message: addressed checkstyle warnings. avoiding to expose test only configurations via mapred-default.xml. Simplified waiting logic for JHS startup.

timeline.bodyText: should this assert happen after the call to start()?
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: Sure. It makes more stable for future change. I updated the code.
replies.author: iwasakims

timeline.message: assertion after starting minicluster should be more stable for future refactoring.
